required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Anagrelide Hydrochloride on Any Changes in Heart Function in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo- and Positive-controlled, 4-Period Crossover Trial to Assess the Effect of Anagrelide Hydrochloride on QT/QTc Interval in Healthy Men and Women.

brief_summary.textblock: According to the ICH Guidance Document E14, all non-antiarrhythmic drugs should be evaluated for their ability to prolong the QT interval which represents the duration of ventricular depolarization and subsequent repolarization. The primary objective of the study is to assess the effect of anagrelide on QT/QTc interval following a therapeutic and supratherapeutic dose of anagrelide when compared to placebo and a positive control.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in QTcNi Intervals From Time-Matched Analysis by Largest Time Point
primary_outcome.description: QT interval corrected for heart rate using the subject-specific method (QTcNi) at the subject-specific time of maximum plasma concentration. The QT interval is the time it takes for the ventricles of the heart to contract and relax. Data were subtracted from the placebo value. The largest time point refers to the estimated largest mean difference between each treatment and placebo among all time points. Values for different treatments can come from different time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in Heart Rate From Time-Matched Analysis by Largest Time Point
primary_outcome.description: The largest time point refers to the estimated largest mean difference between each treatment and placebo among all time points. Values for different treatments can come from different time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in QTcF Intervals From Time-Matched Analysis by Largest Time Point
primary_outcome.description: QT interval corrected for heart rate using Fridericia's method (QTcF) at the subject-specific time of maximum plasma concentration. The QT interval is the time it takes for the ventricles of the heart to contract and relax. Data were subtracted from the placebo value. The largest time point refers to the estimated largest mean difference between each treatment and placebo among all time points. Values for different treatments can come from different time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in QTcB Intervals From Time-Matched Analysis by Largest Time Point
primary_outcome.description: QT interval corrected for heart rate using Bazett's method (QTcB) at the subject-specific time of maximum plasma concentration. The QT interval is the time it takes for the ventricles of the heart to contract and relax. Data were subtracted from the placebo value. The largest time point refers to the estimated largest mean difference between each treatment and placebo among all time points. Values for different treatments can come from different time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in QT Intervals From Time-Matched Analysis by Largest Time Point
primary_outcome.description: The QT interval is the time it takes for the ventricles of the heart to contract and relax. Data were subtracted from the placebo value. The largest time point refers to the estimated largest mean difference between each treatment and placebo among all time points. Values for different treatments can come from different time points.

secondary_outcome.description: QT interval corrected for heart rate using the subject-specific method (QTcNi) at the subject-specific time of maximum plasma concentration. The QT interval is the time it takes for the ventricles of the heart to contract and relax. Data were subtracted from the placebo value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in Heart Rate at Subject-Specific Tmax
Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in QTcF Intervals at Subject-Specific Tmax
secondary_outcome.description: QT interval corrected for heart rate using Fridericia's method (QTcF) at the subject-specific time of maximum plasma concentration. The QT interval is the time it takes for the ventricles of the heart to contract and relax. Data were subtracted from the placebo value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in QTcB Intervals at Subject-Specific Tmax
secondary_outcome.description: QT interval corrected for heart rate using Bazett's method (QTcB) at the subject-specific time of maximum plasma concentration. The QT interval is the time it takes for the ventricles of the heart to contract and relax. Data were subtracted from the placebo value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in QT Intervals at Subject-Specific Tmax
secondary_outcome.description: The QT interval is the time it takes for the ventricles of the heart to contract and relax. Data were subtracted from the placebo value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of 0.5 mg Anagrelide in Males and Females
Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of 2.5 mg Anagrelide in Males and Females
Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Metabolite of 0.5 mg Anagrelide (BCH24426) in Males and Females
Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Metabolite of 2.5 mg Anagrelide (BCH24426) in Males and Females

intervention.description: Anagrelide placebo + Moxifloxacin placebo single oral dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-45 years inclusive at the time of consent. The date of signing informed consent is defined as the beginning of the screening period. This inclusion criteria will only be assessed at the screening visit.
- Subject is willing to comply with any applicable contraceptive requirements of the protocol and is: male, or non-pregnant non lactating female, or females must be at least 90 days post-partum or nulliparous.
- Satisfactory medical assessment with no clinically or relevant abnormalities in medical history, physical examination, vital signs, ECG, and clinical laboratory evaluation as assessed by the investigator.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current or recurrent disease that could affect the action, absorption, or disposition of the investigational product, or could affect clinical or laboratory assessments.
a- Current or relevant history of physical or psychiatric illness, any medical disorder that may require treatment or make the subject unlikely to fully complete the study, or any condition that presents undue risk from the investigational product or procedures.
- Significant illness, as judged by the Investigator, within 2 weeks of the first dose of investigational product.

group.title: Anag 0.5 mg, Then Anag 2.5 mg, Then Placebo, Then Mox 400 mg
group.description: A single oral dose of 0.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 1; then a single oral dose of 2.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 2; then a single oral dose of placebo on Day 1 for Period 3; then a single oral dose of 400 mg of moxifloxacin on Day 1 for Period 4.

group.title: Anag 2.5 mg, Then Mox 400 mg, Then Anag 0.5 mg, Then Placebo
group.description: A single oral dose of 2.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 1; then a single oral dose of 400 mg of moxifloxacin on Day 1 for Period 2; then a single oral dose of 0.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 3; then a single oral dose of placebo on Day 1 for Period 4.

group.title: Mox 400 mg, Then Placebo, Then Anag 2.5 mg, Then Anag 0.5 mg
group.description: A single oral dose of 400 mg of moxifloxacin on Day 1 for Period 1; then a single oral dose of placebo on Day 1 for Period 2; then a single oral dose of 2.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 3; then a single oral dose of 0.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 4.

group.title: Placebo, Then Anag 0.5 mg, Then Mox 400 mg, Then Anag 2.5 mg
group.description: A single oral dose of placebo on Day 1 for Period 1; then a single oral dose of 0.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 2; then a single oral dose of 400 mg of moxifloxacin on Day 1 for Period 3; then a single oral dose of 2.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 4.

group.description: A single oral dose of 0.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 1; then a single oral dose of 2.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 2; then a single oral dose of placebo on Day 1 for Period 3; then a single oral dose of 400 mg of moxifloxacin on Day 1 for Period 4.

group.description: A single oral dose of 400 mg of moxifloxacin on Day 1 for Period 1; then a single oral dose of placebo on Day 1 for Period 2; then a single oral dose of 2.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 3; then a single oral dose of 0.5 mg of anagrelide on Day 1 for Period 4.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in QTcNi Intervals at Subject-Specific Time of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
outcome.description: QT interval corrected for heart rate using the subject-specific method (QTcNi) at the subject-specific time of maximum plasma concentration. The QT interval is the time it takes for the ventricles of the heart to contract and relax. Data were subtracted from the placebo value.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) consists of subjects in the Safety Analysis Set who had at least 1 electrocardiogram (ECG). Safety Analysis Set consists of subjects who received at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

outcome.title: Mean Difference Changes From Baseline Versus Placebo in QTcNi Intervals From Time-Matched Analysis by Largest Time Point
outcome.description: QT interval corrected for heart rate using the subject-specific method (QTcNi) at the subject-specific time of maximum plasma concentration. The QT interval is the time it takes for the ventricles of the heart to contract and relax. Data were subtracted from the placebo value. The largest time point refers to the estimated largest mean difference between each treatment and placebo among all time points. Values for different treatments can come from different time points.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) consists of subjects in the Safety Analysis Set who had at least 1 electrocardiogram (ECG). Safety Analysis Set consists of subjects who received at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
